intro: Spartina merrillii, commonly known as the San Francisco cordgrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, fibrous root system. This plant thrives in brackish and saltwater environments, often found in tidal marshes and estuaries. Spartina merrillii plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various wetland organisms. Its ability to tolerate fluctuating salinity levels makes it an important species in coastal ecosystem restoration efforts.
